src:
Un águila atacó un dron que filmaba un paisaje y la grabación se hizo viral
06 Nov 2019 by Redacción Diario de Cuyo
Un dron que sobrevolaba los picos de Maroon Bells en las montañas Elk, cerca de la localidad de Snowmass Village (Colorado, EE.UU.), fue ferozmente atacado por un águila y registró la impresionante escena en video.



El comediante Joshua Jordan, quien se encontraba pilotando remotamente el aparato, confesó que se llevó un gran susto y que en un principio temió perder el artefacto volador, que le costó 2.000 dólares, pero las poderosas garras del ave rapaz solamente dejaron unos pequeños rasguños en su superficie.
Asimismo, aseguró que el águila resultó ilesa, aunque cree que, la próxima vez, el animal probablemente "se lo piense dos veces" antes de atacar a una 'presa' con cuatro hélices que emita un fuerte zumbido.
text:
An eagle attacked a drone filming a landscape and the recording went viral
06 Nov 2019 by Cuyo Daily Writing
A drone that flew over the peaks of Maroon Bells in the Elk Mountains, near the town of Snowmass Village (Colorado, USA), was fiercely attacked by an eagle and recorded the impressive video scene.



Comedian Joshua Jordan, who was remotely piloting the device, confessed that he took a big scare and that at first he was afraid of losing the flying device, which cost him $ 2,000, but the powerful claws of the raptor left only small scratches on its surface
He also said that the eagle was unharmed, although he believes that, next time, the animal will probably "think twice" before attacking a 'prey' with four helices that emits a loud hum.
